rrHdzH3H5HkmJUWY3FJhcw.text: The worst korean bbq i have ever had. Meats had zero marinade. Bulgogi was just meat, no marinade. Everything took forever to come. Meat was served with no rice. We asked for rice and it came after all the meat was eaten. Soup never arrived despite assurances it was coming. In top of all this, was overcharged $20. If you want slow service, overcharge, auto gratuity, and plain meat, you should eat here. Imagine eating any asian protein with no rice. Complete fail.

xkpKcOvspN6cc4iop4oU5Q.text: Honey Pig rocks! We got the combo B for $59.99 which included 3 variety of meats (including pork belly), kim chee fried rice, bean paste stew, and a beer. It's more than enough to feed four people.   For the price and the amount of meat you get, it's a great value. Would definitely come back on our next visit to las vegas.  Yes service is a bit slow but the yummy food made up for it.

zK-hJ6uzGnz8iasFf6PGow.text: UPDATE: 8/16/2010: I went there again this past weekend and just a side note on the fried rice served at the end.  The first time I went, I had a friend who was Korean and I think we got the rice complimentary because of him. But this time, we had no-one with us that was Korean (or who spoke Korean), so I had to ask for the rice at the end of the meal. I think it is an additional cost, but well worth it. Remember to leave some room at the last for the rice!  -----------------------------  Korean BBQ...   When I say that I think of the open grill and cooking all the meat I can. But Honey Pig is different.   Honey pig gives you this large pot that looks like an inverted wok sitting over a wok style gas burner. What happens at this BBQ house is that the meat is cooked on this "dome".  We just ordered the "all you can eat" choice, I think it was $20 per person (or maybe $25) I can't remember. You can also eat ala carte and they have a bunch of other menu choices.  The AYCE choice starts you off with with kim chee dishes and kim chee and sprouts on the "grill" then the meat comes. We had pork and beef. Oh, they also give you a salad type item, but that is best used for a base to eat the grilled meat...  You cook the beef and eat up, use the "salad", kim chee and sprouts as a base to eat with your meat selections and go to town! After you are almost full, tell the wait staff you are done.  They will then bring some rice over and put it on the grill, anything left on the grill gets' mixed up in the rice and cooked. Leave the rice on the grill until it cooks up and gets a good crust on the bottom. I equate this to the burnt rice chinese grandma's make.   Once the rice is ready, just eat up and fill your belly the rest of the way up. I think in hindside, we'd have ordered a little more meat and get it grilling before asking for the rice. (giving the rice more meat)... hee hee...  Grilling the food this way still produces smoke, but not as much smoke as other Korean BBQ places you're used to going to...  If you plan on going to this place before going out, don't wear your clubbing wear here. go back home and change. But if you're just going back to the smokey casinos, then come as you are.  Enjoy!

Xf7vJBiSQSMgBTLuFweo9A.text: It was okay! It definitly wasn't bad I just don't think I would go visit again. I didn't really like their food choices or the way their menu was set up. It was also the most expensive Korean bbq in my opinion and was not worth the price.

VI7iSAS3PL8Af-oHxgIKwA.text: i was a little hesitant to come in after reading all the reviews, but after consulting with one of my bosses from my internship (i asked him about his kbbq spots awhile ago, and i needed a definite opinion on this place), and he said i had to check it out!!!  19.95 for AYCE but the meat choices were definitely interesting. we got brisket, pork belly and an order of their sirloin. huge servings of kimchee and bean sprouts (which are my fave!). interesting though because they serve it on the grill, and i've never had either warm. but definitely yummy!!! she brought out the rest of the banchan, and sure enough - RICE PAPER!!!!!!! i was sooo happy!!! FINALLY a place in vegas that has rice paper!!!! and - our server (no idea what her name was because her name tag was leaning downwards) kept bringing more after i asked for more the first time we ran out.  the meats were all amazing!!! we got so full we had to sit there for a minute to digest. we will definitely be back!!!!  [the only bad things was - this family came in with their baby and their kid, and the second the kid walked in he wouldnt stop screaming!!! a couple who came in after the family did sat, and they were clearly regulars because all the servers went to say hello, but minutes later, they left. even the servers went over to stop the kid from screaming, but he wouldnt stop!]  note: has anyone tried the pork neck? sounded interesting, but we were so full!!!

425w_QjRkl4Ijd8TeHJ8Pg.text: There is not enough server so I didnt get help as much as I need and it is very expensive and air conditioner is broken

eIEAxXhyfeeyZV3nzYiEgQ.text: Worse place in the world !!!!!!! They made my friend tip them extra by actually forcing him write a different amount, and they still changed the final total. Also the services is rotten. The food is the same everywhere else and the prices were not competitive. The only reason we went to this place was because of a recommendation from a friend.

7lu-OLI9XiNGv-iIm7OFWQ.text: We were in LV for a trade show and usually, I go to Ginseng BBQ on the strip. Coincidentally, I got in to a taxi after dinner at Ginseng who is Korean. So he gave me two of his favorite places to try that don't use MSG. His #1 recommendation was Honey Pig BBQ. A few nights later, we went for dinner and wow! What flavorful food at really good price. For $21.95 each, we had the AYCE BBQ. We ate so well and we also got the kimchi jigae soup. Top notch food. I don't know what is the fuss with the complaints about their service. Every table was well serviced when we went. They were attentive and nice. Don't let those reviews stop you from trying this place out. It is a gem. I am super thankful I lucked out and got in to a taxi with a Korean driver. I scored! Oh and I should note that I travel a lot for my work and I make a point of finding good Korean food in every city, big or small. Trust me, this place is awesome!

G5yeNmW700k9TqP2nlqSOg.text: Food was good. Service was slow. Grilled bean sprout and kimchi was delicious. Not many side dishes, but that could be because we didn't know how to order them.

bixX-j5AQ4lB4Oqenw4lLg.text: Dirty, flys all over, waitress brought 1 menu for party of 3 and she forgot one of the orders, food was just ok and expensive.  So many better Korean restaurants in town.

8-c1RJ7q3UwF-2TQiUVjbg.text: Just came back from Honey pig. I was planning to go for lunch but was told they do not have lunch menu on weekend so we end up paying 19.99 for lunch. The Service was ok with the first 3 dishes of meats, but become harder to harder to get the waitress attention after that even thought there are only 3 tables in the there.  Pork Neck and Belly is good, but we felt like we been screw over with the beef sirloin and short rib. It was suppose to be 1 order each, but we got 3 piece of short rib with 4 people. The sirloin was so little we probably have 2 piece each. I thought that was 1 or 2 orders but end up that's what they are going to give us with 4 people.  The soju are expensive over  $12 a bottle. No Steam Egg or bean paste soup, only sprout soup. The quality of salad is worst I have in Korean BBQ  I only 1 word to describe them. CHEAP~   If you ever eat Korean BBQ at K-town in LA. You will go to this place. I wonder if it's just because we're not Korean.

GIfJTmJaMAfD_w6QKEy6hg.text: I've eaten here one time & I made the mistake of ordering bulgogi without first checking the pricing (really, how expensive can such a common Korean dish be?).  It was good but it turned out to be $20+, not even including tax & tip.  Had it been around $17, I'd give them 4-stars, but at about mid-$20s it was way overpriced.

-VHKsDAW9HvDE0oiqr5KAQ.text: It's lots of Korean BBQ food that you cook yourself so since 20% discount after 10 pm, I went for the first time.  One meat dish was enough for 2 & was splendidly tasty & whatever the 2 of us didn't eat, I took home for the next few days.  They also serve you a family style salad, the small plates of pickles, lots of beansprouts & kim chi on the grill.  I declined the rice since it's too much carb stuff.   At that late time, they were about 65% occupied with sev'l large groups, some family, others friends.  The male waiter did seem absent minded & had no name tag.  (He who shall go nameless).

qDUnl9LLKip__tvDGY7-KA.text: 19.95 for all you can eat Korean BBQ meat?  You'd be a fool NOT to eat here if you love Korean food.  Downsides?  You'll probably eat 3000 calories in one meal here and you'll need to be on fiber supplements for a few days.  Otherwise, great place for dinner and even better if you can drag your ass here after a night of alcoholic binging -- did anyone notice they are only closed for 3 hours!?!

Ag0kHXMkdPlM4XUHDzth1g.text: Our dining experience was interesting to say the least. We ordered a dinner combination that featured: fried rice, beef brisket, soup and pork belly. All entrees were served as courses, first the brisket, soup, pork belly and lastly rice; if you wanted rice with your brisket your SOL. The serves was good minus some minor language barriers (which ended up costing us an additional $25). I rated three stars because our food was good and the staff took the time to grill our food and told us when it was safe to eat.

THQiqynSl3CeWXLLZK1TjA.text: not really a fan of this place. located in the very corner, you probably wouldn't notice they were there. i was hungry so loaded the grill with everything. it was taking too long to cook so i turned up the heat and you probably know what happened next. smoke out. they also didn't want to change or clean my grill so anything else i ate tasted burnt. there wasn't a big selection.

s_4AYZ-U08YsFtL1650ZVg.text: Korean person here and I will have to say our visit was terrible, we ordered nang myeun which was just ok, but our bulgogi was tough and not flame cooked like it should be, it kind of came out sukiyaki style which we didn't want. I should have said something when the lady covered up our cooking table, but some places will cook up the meat in the kitchen and present it all cooked and ready to go, not this time, it came out soupy. The banchan (side dishes) were old and sour! Now maybe they can get away with presenting old over ripe side dished to someone who doesn't know better, but what a poor example to give to someone that knows better. Maybe a off day, but I will never go back. Service was not that thoughtful, just drop and go. There was just my table and another one in the corner, and you could tell there were others there before us because you could see all the old BBQ tables sitting around with old food laying around with no one cleaning up the mess. Yeeeech! a bad example of Korean cooking.

ds9E8Z1uUnCE2zzXgmrMXQ.text: Unfortunate news at the Pig. My hub and I stopped in the other night, and they are not offering AYCE 24-hours. Now, it is only available limited hours, and I am fairly confident she said from 5-10pm. This is not nearly as fun as AYCE at 2am. I guess we'll have to start eating dinner at banker hours if we want to gorge ourselves on kalbi. (Yes, I have abandoned vegetarianism for the time being.)

G0_MK4yw1hSJfnsXdDCaLA.text: Worst Korean BBQ I've ever had. The brisket was fatty and tough, the Kalbi they did have on the Menu they didn't bring out until way later when they've tried to fill you up with the low quality stuff to get you full,   limited sides..... Will not be going back...

jzHh56L-3fTHIzEYRkfVjw.text: Pork belly, Pork belly. Not fancy interiror, It's more like Korean Casual drinking place.  But I go there not to drink but to eat their self grilled delicous pork belly.  I give four starts, which means' Yay! I'm a fan.' I've have been there about 4 times and I will go back whenever I'm in town.

4kHvS-GLrw3x-CMpG_0u-w.text: Wow... their food is really, I mean really good.  I've tried their spicy cold noodles (BeeBim Neng-Myun), marinated beef ribs (LA Kalbi), soft tofu stew (SoonDooBoo), KimChi Stew(Jjigae), Pan-fried Mackerel (go deung uh). The gentleman who was our waiter at first was AWESOME he didn't mind telling us what everything was and explaining what things were. He even brought us a special sauce that was his favorite.  The food was awesome but the reason I give 3 stars is because after our waiter left at the end of his shift, the young ladies who were still working gave less than stellar service. We never had our water or tea refilled and they stood at the counter and stared at us for a good 45 minutes.   The food is worth it though!

-kQnKmngI8aU1fstHQBc0w.text: with less than 39 reviews so far as of aug 1 2010, this joint has to be categorized as a hidden gem because of it's value and quality. you're getting a 40 dollar combo dinner with pork belly, octopus, all the korean fixins, soup, fried rice and a bottle of free beer.  u can share that with 3-4 people, or 2 people but pretty much guarantee u wont finish.  also, the fried rice comes at the end and it's made on the inverse grill by the waitress, this is very good cuz the rice is mixed in with all the fat from the meats (kinda deglazes and soaks in everything into the rice)  Just want to add that they're not affiliated with the honey pig in LA.  the one in LA is not as great (both quality and value).  sidenote: you can cut and cook the meat urself but i would let the waitress do all the work since they're paid and tipped to do this.

ih7AC9hjFBZzOdqV-NttzQ.text: ALL YOU CAN EAT FOR 20 BUCKS? It's a great deal. Food is great. My coworker that is Korean recommended this spot.  Can't wait to go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Honey Pig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First up on all you can eat!

53pF2miANybtxpsBLphBWg.text: A satellite location to the one in LA. This place is your typical Korean BBQ joint that specializes in pork and pork by products! Hence the name "Honey Pig." So, if for whatever reason, you can't part-take in pork or pork by products, this is not the place for you.   But for the rest of us who can! Talk about a nice change of pace in terms of the "other" white meat! Pork  at times is given such a bad name in terms of being called unhealthy, fatty, swine, and etc. It was really nice to see a place that specialized it this forgotten meat.   The meat was pretty good! All of it was nicely seasoned and a nice variety given. There was thinly sliced pork belly, marinated pork short ribs, marinated pork rib eye, and beef short ribs/kali be. The side dishes/Ban-chans' were pretty good, with the most flavor going to the traditional kim chee and the spicy cucumber dish. And just like a traditional Korean BBQ joint, a mixed vegetable bi bim bop is made for you at the end of the meat course. ummm... goes perfectly with some So Ju!  Enjoy

XjB6da1x94VIJ73gwXH5yw.text: This place was my first time eating korean food.  Although it was really yummy, the service left something to be desired.  It's also a little expensive.

PkmSKJ6mmDnPs-dto3e0Ew.text: WAY OVERPRICED!!!! we paid $69.00 for 2 people and it wasn't even all you can eat!!! No lettuce, radish or rice wraps were served. Food was good quality but its hard to mess that up! I've had Korean BBQ 1000% better for $17 per person.  This was $35 per person.  I will never go again... Someone posted I should ask for the "Local" Menu.... You should never have to ask for the local menu...

tpMB9rPUA4xOQpWNwmnczQ.text: This is a good place to come if you are 3 or more people because you can split the bill because the portions are so large. We went there expecting BBQ but We werent able to communicate ordering BBQ in the american traditional sense, they didnt know what we meant when we asked for Barbeque, I think it is just a description of the bbq on the table and the way the food is prepared in front of you. The pork loin shoulder meat was delicious. The variety of condiments made each bite delightfully different in taste. Next time I will drink the iced green tea that is freely provided instead of paying 2 dollars for a can of coke.  I would go back here again and recommend.

BTtQSp6R-o6qAcmropIM4g.text: We were seated right away and left with a pitcher of water.  The AYCE is $20. You can get 3 different items at a time.  First  we got the pork belly, teriyaki chicken, and the bbq beef ribs. The waitress came back with the side dishes of salad, white seaweed thing ( really good), potato mix, and cucumber thing ( we don't really know much about Korean bbq ).   She cooked the meat for us and also the kimchee and bean sprouts.  Pork Belly - excellent ordered a 2nd servings Teriyaki Chicken- ok, nothing special didn't taste like teriyaki beef ribs- good   Next order: Soup- good broth, didn't serve it to us until after we ate our first                portion. Marinated beef- good flavor Spicy pork- good taste like Filipino tocino Fried Rice- ok cooked at the end of the meal, we should have ordered it earlier.   Korean Ice tea was really good but they didn't serve it to us until after we asked for a water refill.  Service got slow after they became busy, they only had 2 waitresses.   Overall we'll come back and try more things we saw everyone else eating.  AYCE is only  11am - 3pm for lunch ($12.95) and 5pm - 10pm ($19.95) dinner

2BfdwSuv0kQMMaBZTQyTrg.text: For $14 bucks you can't expect any better quality. The reason why they did not get the 2 additional stars is because they did not have rice paper! When we demanded some, they brought out a small plate and said this is it. The second reason is because we didn't get the fried rice at the end. Granted, we already had 9 plates of meat between four guys, but still.. It's principle!  I'll be back tho.   Btw, the owner needs more workers.. I felt bad for the only server there.

AVrQs078NMwg179vfscB3g.text: We dashed in here before my flight and weren't disappointed.  While I don't expect awesome Korean food in Las Vegas (there just isn't a large enough constituency for it), I was pleasantly surprised.  Plenty of food, even more soju, and a friendly waitress made for a pleasant, if not rushed experience.  Next time I'm back in town (which should be in a month or two), I'm going to have to hit this place.

uHCu3T0X47Mmb3soR_FF-A.text: I love their Galbi Jim (or Kalbi Jjim).It's the BEST!!. I've eaten Galbi jim everywhere...from all over the Bayarea,CA, at my Korean friends' houses, even in Korea..but this place seems to make it the BEST!!!. I really suggest it..  Oh,After all the barbecuing, the lady comes out with a bowl of rice and makes fried rice with all the flavors and drippings from the meats right on top of the grill. Absolutely delicious..!!..

vtitopcUh8v49zpvwsRVog.text: Save your money, do your appetite a favor and go down the street to Sura BBQ or Tofu Hut for your Korean BBQ needs. The prices there are over the top expensive, but worse of all.. THE SERVICE IS HORRIBLE!  If you HAVE to go to Honey Pig to eat..  go ahead and do it because whenever someone tells you  not to touch the hot stove-- you have to do it anyways. But just remember when you're paying for the bill and calculating how much tip you should leave.. "I told you so!"   When I came in with my cousins 3 days ago, there were 4 Korean girls working the front.  We asked for a table and sat down, checking out the menus.. but as soon as we sat down and looked around, my 2 cousins and I all noticed that 3 of the 4 girls standing at the counter were whispering to each other and kept glancing over at our table They were laughing and staring, making it VERY obvious they were whispering some crap about us. I ended up making eye contact with them and one of the girls didn't even bother to look away. She stared at me for a few seconds and then turned her head to finish working.. but the whole night she didn't bother to come over to check up on us. This happened a few more times during the night. They would not stop whispering and laughing and then glancing over to us every time we asked for a refill, or some food item! It was horrible, we felt so disrespected. Coincidentally, the  restaurant got busy about 30 minutes later.. with tables that were majority groups of men coming to dine and drink beer.  There had to have been about 7 tables with groups of men, and we were the ONLY table there with 3 girls. The whole time we were there, only 1 girl had the decency to come over and check up on us without us calling for them, while all of them would constantly check back and forth to all of the tables with the men. I'm not trying to be judgmental, but I swear it was so obvious that they were trying to please the other people (for more tips probably). The whole experience was unprofessional, and downright disrespectful for us.  On top of bad service, as far as their menus.. it was ridiculously overpriced! Now, I am a really big food adventurer and work in a 5 star Japanese restaurant.. so when it comes to spending a lot of money on food, I'm not unfamiliar with. I don't mind as long as its good quality, or exotic. AND as far as Korean BBQ, I am a huge fan of therefore I have tried all Korean BBQ restaurants I know in Vegas. Honey Pig's all you can eat is $20 (which in the beginning, I thought was decent) .. BUT everything else was over $25 for a plate! Their single plate BBQ (just raw meat) started off at $25 for simple brisket.. Every other type of meat, including even pork belly was $25 and more!  My cousins and I ended up getting the all you can eat, which was $60 + tax for 3 people. The meat was alright nothing different from the other Korean restaurants..but the thing that bothered us the most was how the waitresses portioned our servings. We had each ordered different items on the all you can eat list.. and when we told her to bring out a plate of everything so we can try each.. SHE LOOKED AT US LIKE WE WERE CRAZY. I mean, wtf? We're paying $60 for all you can eat! In the end, she DIDN'T bring us all of the plates, only the first 4 things we asked for.. and on top of that, the portions got smaller and smaller as we ordered more. It was unbelievable. It got to the point where my cousin didn't even want to ask for more food because the girl had come back about 4 times already. They were being so cheap with their all you can eat. They assumed  that we were 3 girls, therefore we shouldn't have be getting the same amount as a table full of men. There was no rice either, so none of us got really full.  Overall, I DO NOT recommend this place if you're looking for quality Korean BBQ. It has nothing special. Like Tofu Hut (there AYCE is only $14), or even Korean BBQ in the Chinatown plaza (which is more expensive than Tofu Hut).. it's the same type of meat and style of cooking..   The service at  Honey Pig is absolutely disgusting. Even if you don't like AYCE, their combination dishes are ranged from $40 for 2 people and increase a good $30 after that for 3 and so on ... You're still spending an average of $25 there regardless. And for bad service too. I STRONGLY don't recommend.

V9CZWSgSrPwzVwvf3ZHc7g.text: THE WORST Korean bbq I've ever been to. I don't know if its because we weren't Korean and I really don't even care. I noticed most of the bad reviews were for larger groups - there were 6 in our party, but again who cares about excuses. Maybe we should've known not to go since it was a Friday night and only 2 tables were taken out of probably 15. But the name is so cute and it had generally good reviews on yelp. So we went, had some overpriced $12 soju (retail $3) and everyone got all you can eat. The guy wouldn't let me start w kalbi and spicy pork - said no do the brisket because it cooks faster. That wasn't a suggestion he wouldn't let me start with what I wanted. They brought out the sides,like 4 things - more regular kim chee, radish, some kind of fermented fish and these cute little pancakes. The selection sucked I asked for cucumber kim chee she said we don't have that, soy sauce potatoes "we don't have that", more of the pancakes pls "you only get one" WTF!  Brisket is done and they bring out another pile of kim chee and bean sprouts to cook. Its pretty obvious they were trying to fill us up with the cheap sh*t. They brought out kalbi finally when it was done we asked for more and we were told it was 1 order per person, which it does say in the menu. I told him no there are 6 ppl and the amnt you brought out was serving for 2 or 3. I didnt say it but F*ck that. He went to the back and brought out more. Yay.... I asked for shik-hye for the end of the meal "we don't have that". Everyone on yelp said the best part was the fried rice they make on your grill. I was looking forward to this light at the end of a craptastic tunnel. The kim chee fried rice was ok, nothing special. We got the bill which wasn't itemized just a bunch of prices and a total, so we asked what everything was.  Those mofos charged us $4.95 x2 for that fried rice! Maybe this goes back to the not being Korean issue but I never saw a charge mentioned in any other reviews.  We paid and left w out leaving a tip. Not something any of us normally do, but that really was the worst dining experience I've ever had. I almost hoped they would come running out asking about a tip like I've read in other bad reviews on this place.  My suggestion - don't bother w honey pig! Go to woo che its in the same shopping center right off of spring mtn, its where we normally go for Korean bbq. Its cheaper, has other prepared food included, you pick what meat you want and cook what you want when you want it. Service is also very nice. This is what I get for trying something new

J-eXikyq9nUx0DACGmJ-nQ.text: The worst customer service ever ... Had to wait a long time for them to bring us the meat for the grill , we order $25 all u can eat menu and it wasn't worth it ..... I won't be coming back here ...

ywprCB9WQT3CUVKAlLBkcQ.text: Next time when I go back there I will bring a Korean friend to translate.  I couldn't communicate with the waitress because she couldn't speak English at all.  But their food and service is excellent. Anyone have $20 in their pocket should try their all u can eat BBQ.  Not to mention they open 24/7.

JtrfxNAZd_hhwdKOSkNgyw.text: I have never heard of korean barbeque without lettuce!!!! They gave us some kind of salad that was bland. I just didn't enjoy the meat cause they were tasteless that i literally had to dip everything in the sesame oil to get some taste in it. Coming from a korean background i have tasted better and expected more from a Korean restaurant.

0r8veBymE899mK0aeCNbaw.text: I've been looking for AUTHENTIC Korean food ever since I arrived in Las Vegas three years ago....the other night I found it.  I was sitting in my living room drinking Vodka and watching Anthony Bourdain travel to Seoul. He ended up in a barbecue pork restaurant and I got crazy watching.   I've lived and worked in South Korea for since 1971 and sometimes I NEED some Korean food. So anyway, there was Bourdain drinking SoJu and eating pork and I just had to have some. It was about 12:30 am and I stumbled into Honey Pig. I left about an hour later a very happy guy.  Honey Pig is authentic as it gets. So many Korean "barbecue"  restaurants in the US "westernize" their food that I'm often disappointed. There's great Korean in LA and NY but here in Vegas you never know what you're going to get.  Give me pork or beef on a hot grill, Chi-ge and SoJu and I'm happy, happy, happy. When the food and atmosphere remind me of some of the wonderful late night places I've enjoyed over the years in Seoul and I'm ecstatic.   I went back to Honey Pig today for lunch just to make sure I wasn't too drunk to really judge last time. I wasn't mistaken. The Nang Myun (cold noodles in broth) and Kalbi were delicious.  If you're in Vegas and hungering for Korean food anytime of the day or night (they are open 24 hours a day) don't hesitate to try Honey Pig.

Ut0SIGLx_w652xAYD_jb7g.text: WHY isn't this place 5 stars from everyone?  I pay taxi fare everytime I goto vegas just because the food is AMAZING.  The samgyupsaal here with the bokeumbaap is probably my favorite dish in the world.   Go here around 4 am and see the working girls come in with their "oppas" and other club girls that just got out of "work."  Who doesn't like entertainment with their food?   Everyone must go.

TtLACRWPhqfqE4xI9vHNRQ.text: Ok so I went here with a bunch of friends and we were all starving so you know that cardboard with some peanutbutter would have tasted good at that point.  So I was so excited to eat here just by the name alone.  We got the all you could eat special and boy was that a let down.  They just kept feeding us beansprouts and kimchee thaty was cooked on the grill and then in between gave us our meat dishes.  They seemed to be trying to fill us up with more and more cooked kimchee,  FInally we said that we didnt come here for the kimchee but came here for meat.  Then the soju was liked the most expensive I have ever gotten at a bbq place it was $12 a small bottle. So all I have to say ..it sucked

NxM-nrWcll4DKDIqPzBykQ.text: Samgyeopsal-gui !!!!  Yummm I love pork belly and this is the place to eat it.  We went for dinner and decided on set A as it had the pork belly.  Yummmm.  We wanted to try this place as we recently was introduced to Honey Pig in Buena Park, CA.  The kimchee is perfect and just how I like it not fresh but not super sour either but just right!  The fried rice at the end was awesome wish we could eat it during and not at the end as we were already stuffed but managed to eat some.  The staff was nice and attentive.  The price is reasonable.  I would definitely go there again.

KJRGVt31oEhujfiUE7eXoA.text: Wait freakin long for the order!!!! Bad service, food was so so! Definitely won't come again!

93oWK-fSSgZhjsPY_7Yj4Q.text: Wow! Very yummy! I do enjoy Sura for the buffet style so it's more comfortable to go and get exactly what you want when you want it.  However, Honey Pig had great quality meat and a helpful staff. Plus you can't beat the yummy  (fried rice) served at the end of the meal!  They do charge for leftovers which is expected but they seem to be pretty understanding for having left over rice and giving us a Togo box.   Btw: drinking too much hite (beer) led to me forgetting the Togo box on the table!!! OMG I HOPE THEY DONT HATE ME!!! I'm sooooo sorry! I really wanted my fried rice for later ... Still crying about it!   So remember to take your leftovers you'll cry later if you forget!

Sh_ATzThoG4Goh4Lb_s1hw.text: We went here on Saturday night, and we chose the all you can eat course. The food is not bad, but the service was so slow, the stuff can not handle our table.

f7-LmtbMrmNdg3rH4-YoKA.text: We had combo set A with pork belly both two times we were there. It was so good both time. The pork belly was tender it melt in your mouth. Although the meat are not flavored with anything but the salad and dipping sauces go with them were very flavorful.  Kimchi was so good. The soup was decent nothing was special.  Kimchi Fried rice was to die for, so delicious, flavorful and spicy. I always box the rice home and it is still good the next day.  Cons: waitress was not friendly at all, no communication the whole time. But she did come back to check on us. The side dishes were not as good as other Korean restaurants.

BDcBd7n2vE8bOzkD6-rkyw.text: Well my girlfriend and I came here for dinner one night because she had told me that this place was amazing for the price. I have never been to a Korean BBQ place before, and from what I heard from the girlfriend and many of my asian friends, this place was the place to be at.  When we walked in, it was fairly quiet. Many other patrons were quietly eating their food. It looked like Honey Pig was airing out the restaurant by opening all the doors and windows, and having the vents on full power. Honestly it sounded like a factory or something haha. No biggie though, I'm there for the nitrosamine foods, not the noise.  My girlfriend and I got the AYCE, which included several different meats. In my opinion, everything tasted great, but I especially enjoyed the bulgogi and the Sirloin. The Ribs were delicious as well! There was squid included, but honestly I don't like the texture of squid. My girlfriend said it was good though, so there's my review on that haha.  I was very impressed with the attentiveness of our waitress. She came by often to help us grill and also bring more meat out. Although there were times where she looked like she had too many people to manage, she never forgot any request that we had.  That cinnamon drink at the end tho!!! I think I wanted to take a gallon home! Haha! Overall this place was great for the price. Would I come back? Yeah probably... I hear there are many great Korean BBQ places in Vegas so maybe I'll check all of them out also.

_Y0cKYeuB_vWRTTH1W7TIA.text: Always a must eat destination whenever we are in Vegas. Never disappoints. The food is always great. The waitress during this visit was so accommodating. Good idea to go during lunch - cheaper price for the same food you would get for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Honey Pig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All you can eat for lunch

MmZDOEOdBHUpkrsHXU_5sg.text: Great place if you want "All you can eat Korean BBQ". Huge parking lot, fast seating, good atmosphere, great service and food. You will not be disapointed with this restaurant. All you can eat is until 10:00pm

photos.caption: Photo of Honey Pig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Always a good time !

DNfTxql48nD--bvOAzO-_w.text: "Hey, Sandy, so the other day I was at --" "Stop talking! There's not enough time! The meat is cooking faster than we can pull it off the grill! HUSTLE!"   Whenever people are trying out KBBQ for the first time, they always make the same observation: "So you're telling me I am paying money to cook for myself AND serve myself?" You are, indeed!   The thing about Honey Pig is that the servers will actually place the meat on the grill for you, but the actual cooking is up to you. So if you are two people like we were in the conversation above, it doesn't leave too much time for conversation because you are too busy cooking, chewing, timing, grabbing, flipping, drinking, etc. Notice how "waiting" is not one of the above? AIN'T NOBODY GOT TIME FOR THAT. Since the servers are putting the meat (+ kimchi, bean sprouts, and onions) on the grill for you, there's not a lot of freedom to pace the cooking process.   My friend and I opted for AYCE, so each round just seemed rushed. The only time anything was NOT was in the beginning, when we asked for water - they said OK, and then forgot - and at the end, when we asked for the check - they said OK, and then forgot. Hmm. So perhaps not the best first and last impression.

wQMV1k1QJ_p3NreE5QCZxQ.text: The server with glasses is soooo RUDE! Poorest server I have ever had!!! There was a BUG in my dish and the serve didn't say sorry at all. Service was slow and ridiculous! Don't go there!

WfWHA_A-MsBE0upuiDyggw.text: Skip the buffet one night and head here.  A good Korean friend knew about this place and recommended it.  I'm so thankful!  We came here this past Saturday night.  Our Korean friend ordered everything for us... all our faves.  Everything is cooked right in front of you.  There's a ton of food, lots of meat, great kimchi.   With 6 total guys, the more meat, the better.  Pile it on please.  We had soju and beer, of course.  These are the necessities for every Korean meal.    The name of the place is great.  I love what they cook the food on.  Definitely an experience if you've never tried Honey Pig.  I heard they have several locations in LA.  Bring it to NYC!

vxqU6LBlFgJTqnsfjIGStQ.text: I seem to go here more often with my cousins late at night. Great because they're aren't that many people and it stays open really late. Parking is easy because it's in the Big Lots shopping plaza. Lot's of tables for a small restaurant and each table is reasonably spaced from each other. No bumping chairs with your neighbor.   Service is great, especially if you're one of only a few tables seated. They give LOTS of food! Between the 4 of us, we were really full with the #2 (comes with either soju or a beer). They also cook the food for you and our server was very attentive to our food. Also, they do not change out the grill, instead clean it, so you don't have to wait for the new grill to heat up to cook the rest of your food. The grill is also very big, so you can cook lots of food at once and not have to wait for more food to cook. Our server also turned on the vent, something that Sura didn't do for us when when I went there for my cousins.   I like the quality of the meat. It all tastes so very good. The pork belly is my favorite. Not too much fat but enough to give it that pork belly flavor. Beef was very tasty as well, all seemed fresh. And that fried rice at the end!! Save room for the rice! And save some meat to mix with the rice at the end too.   I will DEFINITELY come back here again!

hjezxTRebEieMw-Rii5v8g.text: It's was 12:00am in the morning, there was about 4 tables seated and one server. We waited about 20 minute before being seated, then about another 40 minute before the waitress came and ask for our order.   Then my sister's boyfriend had a question about something on the menu,then the waitress said she didn't have time to answer his question as she was busy serving other diners and left us.  After about another 10 minute of waiting for her to come back, we decided to do her a favor and leave as she was indeed busy.  Whether or not the food is good we wouldn't know, it's not really the waitress fault but, the restaurant should consider hiring another person to help out as well. : /

yHAvUc2H0oxKFuyR8rNSFQ.text: Our first time eating Korean BBQ .... Wow!  Great experience!  Becky was a great host and waitress.  The fact that everything is done for you at your table really makes for a great experience.  Yes, there's Benihana, etc... But for $45 plus tip, we had amazingly fresh steak and brisket plus all the side dishes that come with it.  This was a slow served 4 course meal... Which I loved so be I prefer to nibble then scarf my food.  And it comes with a large bottle of beer or small bottle of Soju.

photos.caption: Photo of Honey Pig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We got all this plus table side made rice and soup.  Delicious!!

NxqrYrDbf5KxtJ7PihRQWg.text: I had their AYCE for the first time. Very disappointed. I ordered 4 different meats right away, but they only delivered 1.    I asked again, where's my other meats? 15 minutes of waiting and finally she brought another one (yes, they brought one by one). By the time the fourth meat arrived, the grill already burnt.   So I asked for the grill to be replaced. The server totally ignored my first request.  I asked again, and this time with a different server to have the grill replaced. She told us rudely that we should order meat without sauce first next time. I explained nicely that I ordered 4 meats right away, and I expected to cook the one without the sauce one first. But unfortunately, the one the other server brought was the one with the sauce first. I had no choice but to cook the one with the sauce first.  Each of the plate we ordered has a very small portion. For example, the short ribs we ordered, it only came with 2 pieces. And if you need to ask another plate, it will take another 10-15 minutes.   They also helped cooking the meat for us with the tong that they use for both raw and cooked food. Cross contamination everywhere. Oh, and the potato appetizer I requested, never arrived..   I wouldn't go back ever..

oO2GfbkvpY5LyDpJRNTecg.text: I think Honey Pig is my new frontrunner favorite for Korean AYCE. Mostly because I loooove their Kimchi, and they give you buckets of it.  The AYCE is a little spendier than similarly priced places, but the superior cuts of meat more than made up for it. They have all our groups perennial favorites, including beef tongue, so everyone in our group was happy.   They were packed, and packed with big groups on the night we were there. And everyone we saw looked like they were having a blast. We certainly were.  Pros; - Great food at a very affordable price.  - Great for groups up to 8.  - So much Kimchi. So much warmed, delicious kimchi. I'll take a bucket, please. - Tons of sides  Cons; - Can get packed, and when they get packed, service starts to slow down.  - Can be a little bit hard to find your first time. It's in the back corner of the little strip mall. Look for that happy pig.

AlkkCnltIkixsDrQHRR3XA.text: Whenever someone says Korean bbQ I'm always down for it. Good thing about honey pig is that it's open 24/7 so even at 3am I can get my fix. Great for people who work late nights too. There's always people there late at night so you won't be the only one. But most likely they're drunk lol. I've seen people stumble around and be super loud in the restaurant. But I don't mind it. It's not ayce but they have set meals that will fill you up. Their meats aren't as good as other kbbQ places but it still hits the spot. Lots of banchan and they make fried rice at the end which I love! They also cook for you too. Beef tongue isn't as tender as other places and is kind of dry here. Whenever I get the set meal and split it with 1 other person we always have leftovers especially since they make the fried rice at the end. Save some meat for that too! It's tastyyyy

Dj46rCYnpBtbuSaAcT3fLA.text: I thought the lunch was $17.99 but during the weekend it is all day dinner price for $24.99 per person.  The only difference between dinner and buffet is that you get only one order of short ribs and one or two other item.  That is a rip.  This is not a self serve buffet, where you get you own meat.  You have to actually order from the waitress and they get it and cook it in front of you. The problem is sometimes you want more of one item than another.  The items they have are very limited.  The reason why I gave two stars is because they only give you two small bowls of rice for an all you can eat .  Also I am Asian.  Just like most Asians, I eat a lot of rice, especially with all you can eat meat buffet. I don't know of any Asian culture where you get more meat than rice. After I requested a second bowl of rice the waitress actually warned me that she will have to charge me for an extra bowl.  What the What. And this is a SMALL bowl of rice. it is less than 8 ounces. How can you eat hot and spicy foods with out rice.  This might be worth it for $12.99 but not for $17.99 or $24.99. It is not worth it. I hate going to a restaurant and feeling ripped off and I felt ripped off here.

XIP27mGUT8UCXyYPRMwJgg.text: Korean BBQ on Steriods!  Traditional Cooking style! Must Try!

EDv5iN8Lxvlj_1ZYAyPxGw.text: YES. Lunch special, $4.99 ramen and kimchi!   I ordered the spicy kimchi ramen, and my boyfriend ordered the beef ramen. We were both very pleased. Full of flavor, large portions and left with a $10.98 bill. Stoked!!   We will be back because, boy, did all those sizzling meats look DELICIOUS.

qXNxeE1t4wU-2XtBQ3BWYw.text: The most unique thing they have is the Giant Grill which make the servers can make the fried rice at the end of the BBQ. Additionally they launched very brand new menu, the Intestine. It was a combination of Big and Small Intestine and tripe with some vegetables, and garlic, etc. The texture was pleasant chewy and juicy. I recommend this place and the menu for some special experience of Korean cuisine!

Photo of Honey Pig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried rice
Photo of Honey Pig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small intestine

g9Lw0rNQ3twvxmUkSREwgA.text: Jake was our server at 9pm For a party of 8. He was wonderful, service was great and food was amazing.

dxL42v7s9ayl0_kJ5ssupQ.text: I got food poisoning from eating here. The area is also very dirty and sketchy. The restaurant inside is not too bad but maybe the kitchen is dirty since I got sick immediately after I ate here. Beware!

Mp_mP0tj5lcE48ahJFTtGw.text: It was fun hanging out with good friends for dinner. The price is comparable to other K BBQ but we were here fir the good food and fried rice at the end. Staff usually cooks the food but we had veterans with lots of K BBQ experience. Overall good experience.

l2t_zNw6i5jDufKmZP84og.text: Tried their AYCE. With very few options, it was definitely not worth the $28! Service was disappointing- they were friendly but not attentive. Asked for several items that we gave up on ... and there was only one other table there!! The food that did arrive was not good in quality. The overall experience was disheartening as this was my friend's birthday dinner. Next time, we'll definitely stick with Hwaro!

BV4hz6zzmAtuDQfHkwAkKQ.text: Kimchi grill is really good Short rib bbq is delicious Friendly staffs One of my fav restaurant in Las Vegas

QSn94ueXiCondJu7PLrQuQ.text: The staff here made me feel uncomfortable. They burned our rice and then told us that was how it was supposed to look but we wouldn't know because "we're not Korean." It was disrespectful. I may not be but I know the difference between burnt rice and good rice. Thank you , next

lSMOwq2CMXdtcRO8PF2x4g.text: My husband and I came here because we went to hwaro bbq first and they were packed. This was the next closest one and when we arrived we were considering leaving because the parking lot seemed empty and there was maybe only 3 tables here. We assumed the food must not be that great but we were tired and just wanted to eat something so we stocked around. Boy were we glad.  We got their famous honeycomb pork Belly and I'm not an avid meat eater so we only ordered one order but it was more than enough for us mainly due the husband eat the meat and I ate the side dishes! One order comes with about two slabs of pork belly (super thick slabs), 5 side dishes, salad, and grilled kimchi and bean sprout. At the end with your leftover they make fried rice on the stovetop/grill.   Even though this place is not an ayce bbq the meat quality is better. So basically you pay for the meat. The atmosphere is quiet too

BRp4FJ1yupznMwhlHnYLig.text: We went on a Saturday and actually did not get past the ordering stage.  My wife decided she wanted a bento box instead of the AYCE Korean BBQ.  Their AYCE menu clearly states that ala carte customers can not share with AYCE customers, but does not say that the entire table must be AYCE.  We tried talking to the server, but all she could say was "read the rules", which she obviously did not understand since they were in English.  Also, they had water cups upside down on saucers at the tables, and mine was about 1/4 full of liquid when I grabbed the cup, hopefully it was water.  The table area around the round BBQ was very small and absolutely everything was covered in a film of grease.  I rarely do harsh reviews, but no thanks on this one.

D_V1mkyD-SpSCmRyWPit-Q.text: Beef quality and service were ok , I asked for side of jalapeno twice! it never came and I gave up.

yy8VV6u04Mh7cdQ8XXVyRA.text: This place is very good, the food is cheap and the quality is good. Not to mention, we ordered a $60 combo and we had 5 people to share, we were all very full. The service was very good too, the girl that was helping us literally was there to cook for us, even tho most Korean bbq does offer that too. I still recommend coming here, especially this place opens till very late.

KRH54NHmsgKEVOu7-OddXQ.text: The food is great. However for a 24/7 joint they should prolly staff a little more than one waiter for 7 active tables. The food is great however and the chigae is awesome. I would totally recommend coming here for the food. Just prolly not in the early Hours of the morning cause service will be slow.

4FvelkQ0-__9bH33w9NqpA.text: Jake - thank you for taking care of me and my family who were visiting from out of town! You were so quick to take our order and bring back our constant requests for more kimchee & bean sprouts. And even more importantly you juggled between 3 tables, and we're even nice enough to play a couple of songs for my Aunt. It's been a while since we've last eaten here but I know we'll be back soon. Our favorite part of the set meal was definitely the kimchee fried rice at the end! The food as always was yummy and we appreciate you & your hard work. Thank you again!

photos.caption: Photo of Honey Pig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9i2rFvU72VybzpeFC8sQvQ.text: I really like this place. We usually come and get the all you can eat. The only thing I don't like about this place is how hot it is inside with all the heat coming from the table.

dmSy8iCamWRxyFHMSVQ8lQ.text: Horrible service!!! seated for 10mins didn't bother to even walk our way and serve us. Never going back there again!!!!

wc78IwD3CO1Fi44dySXq1w.text: Honey Pig is a KBBQ restaurant, but it is not all you can eat like some others in the valley. You order from a prefixed menu that comes with a different combination of meats. I usually eat at A.Y.C.E. so I am used to actually cooking the food.  To my surprise, the staff here started to do the cooking for me when the meats arrived. When I was close to touching the tongs to move around some meat, the server said it was okay she got it and she proceeded to do most of the cooking. However, I assumed she would do all of the cooking since she stopped me from moving around the meat initially. But, lo and behold, 20 minutes into the meal, my table is forgotten about and I was forced to move my meat before they were burnt. No one likes burnt Korean barbecue.

5TnAAOkXC6kVgC4rszg2AQ.text: Came here at around 11ish. The waitress lady was so nice and helpful with the service. The food is decent for its price but the service makes up for this place! Anyone who likes a late night meal of korean bbq, highly recommend it here!!

M-thm8k8hTB0yZ6ieyFE3w.text: The service was weak, meat lacked the marinades, unreasonable packages, and not really an appealing location.  I've heard a lot about this place but you won't be hearing much from me.  I was just disappointed by the female server who was a bit rude and impatient. Normally in KBBQ, servers are highly attentive and friendly. I did not get that here.  The meat was not very tasty and the packages were a not appealing as what other restaurants offer. When the meat came out, it was just okay. The side dishes did not amaze and their house sauces weren't as flavorful. Overall, I did not enjoy this restaurant to the hype it was given.

G40sBoJ6Sj_UWnNbiHiR1w.text: Had high expectations for this place but it was a real let down. When we went in for AYCE during lunch they were out of most of their sides. The meat was sub par, the rice old and overall just low quality.  Worst of all was the service. The waitress brought out multiple wrong items and then argued with us that we were wrong not her. She forgot things and just really didn't care. We were the only customers in the restaurant at 11:30am. We won't be going back.

Q8i1xbHq0Vn66Z6klz9W-A.text: My go to KBBQ in Vegas is Hwaro or Tofu Hut. Went to Hwaro after work and it was packed, did not want to wait so opt for Honey Pig for the first time. Honey Pig AYCE is $25. From the AYCE menu it did not have as much variety as the other KBBQ places I've been to. I was disappointed it did not come with soup or steamed eggs like most KBBQ places. They charged extra on top of the $25 for soup ($5) egg or the other items that most AYCE comes with. Also they only let you order 3 items 1 time... When there's already only a few items to start with. Overall, the service was nice they constantly refill your water and check on you. But for the price, I think there's defiantly better KBBQ in Vegas for cheaper that comes with more variety.

photos.caption: Photo of Honey Pig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eAvHZ2ZDmyYv4NAR2JgCbA.text: It's pretty good just needs a little 'facelift" people were nice I'll go back anytime when I feel like eating Korean food

pfZiFcDz9GfYdbmdVXpwLw.text: Apparently this restaurant no longer does AYCE. I'm not sure if that's a new rule or because we came with a large party, about 16 people. But even the marquee sign out front claimed there was AYCE. Anyway, we had to do 4 orders of the large combination, about $100 an order. This evened out to about one large combo good for 4-5 people. This included (per order) soup, a soda pitcher, brisket, bulgogi, pork belly and neck, and steak. The selection was decent. I was very disappointed when they offered the fried rice special, basically mixing fried rice with left over kimchee and bean sprouts, at the very end, when all the meat was gone. Note to self and others, ask for that up front. The service was great. Our server definitely earned his gratuity and was around frequent to check on the cooking, was quick with request, and very polite. I enjoyed This Korean BBQ, but I'm unsure if I'll come back. The only plus size was they can accommodate a large group without having to separate the party.

kVt5_SB26mgZ88OikuwMlA.text: What's not to love about all you can eat perfectly prepared meat??? This location is okay... Service was mediocre but the food was great.

pc5FqWodKtXawYt0V0FmyQ.text: This used to be my favorite AYCE Korean BBQ spot but unfortunately they've raised their prices and shrunk the menu :( You can't do both and expect people to still love you the same!!   They have also cut down on the Banchan dishes that they give out as well as the salad. There used to be a variety of greens but now it is just lettuce. BOO  Their service is not to be praised or frowned upon. They will get to you in a timely manner and your initial order of meat will arrive shortly BUT you will not see them much afterwards. It does not matter if they are busy or slow.   Their food makes up for everything else. Their pork belly is very good! Probably my favorite out of all the spots I've tried in town.   After seeing that their prices have gone up and their menu has shrunk but service has not improved to make up for these factors...I will probably choose to go elsewhere if I am craving Korean BBQ

WxqPBfy8xa0dURSchTr5EQ.text: Total bait and switch. They advertise AYCE and they even tell us that the combination dinner covers food for the entire table.  The menu looks no different than any other AYCE restaurants.  But as it turns out, there was no AYCE.  We found out later as we wanted to get more meat, and this was during dinner on a Wednesday night, the place was only two thirds full at most throughout the night.  Our first clue should have been to leave when we found out they didn't have chicken on the menu, but then they agreed to substitute the squid in the combo for chicken, so we decided to stay - big mistake.  If you have kids that only eat chicken, it is not enough meat for what they provide you.  They did come over and help us cook, and they did refill our Korean style ice tea.  But when the bill came, a $69.99 combination quickly turned into $99.47, and we only had 1 beer.  Turns out they had added gratuity already, but we were just 3 adults plus 2 kids under age 5.  We had to ask for more salad as the bowl was rather small for our table.    Such a huge disappointment for a nice promising name like Honey Pig.  It was enough food for up to 3 adults, no more than that, plus we had to request the rice.

k87qrQTpMqn8WOxKiQ1qXA.text: I went here for AYCE with a party of 3.  The restaurant was pretty empty but we received bad service.   I can look past the service if the food is good, but it was average at best. They also have a limit on galbi in their ayce, which makes it a worse kbbq option than the many others around town.

OBT29vmuoVUfnxe5sPhVtw.text: Ohhh-Myyyy-Gaaaaaaaaaah.  Forget "Pho Kim Long," this is the new must eat after drunken debauchery late night eats.  Open 24 hours and all you can eat for $20. Are you effing kidding me??? Sure, it isn't as fun as saying you're going to "pho kim long" after the club but, whatevers....you just spend $$$ at the club and you're hungry....this is a good place to save some money and eat your drunken little heart out on KBBQ.  You feel fat, bloated, and hungover in the morning but, isn't that what Vegas is really about? YES, it is. Thank you!

Photo of Honey Pig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. done.
Photo of Honey Pig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fat, literally.

a6uO3VNehRTpktl8bWaOqg.text: That was my first visit and last ever.  There was six of us for all you can eat. We gave $14 for tip for rude service and we were asked to tip more. It was offensive and inappropriate. We ended up give $5 more for forever-parting gift.  Like I said, there was six of us. Only one pitcher of water/tea was on the table. Every time we begged for more water they will give us a pitcher full of ice. You have to be careful every time you pour or you will have ice spilled all over the table and your shirt, and at one point I have to get up and get water myself.  Another thing about this place is they are so understaffed, and they want to give a half-ass "full service". The servers tried to cook the food for us and we always ended up a full grill of vegetables with minimum amount of "meat". I thought this is a BBQ place, not a vegetarian eatery.  I strongly suggest if you want to be treated like a sucker and be served tasteless food, vegetarian if I might add, and wait 20 minutes for everything. please go give this place a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Honey Pig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. looks better than it taste
Photo of Honey Pig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. pork belly, and they were very stingy about them

-u9ZQL6gMB4O7i-BueGcXA.text: My favorite Korean bbq place. The quality of the meat and sides are top notch. Certain meats like the short ribs and sirloin are only available to order once on the ayce menu. Service is fast but not too friendly. My favorite is the beef brisket and the pork belly.

yX_VmH1y_zGF91THJOiovg.text: This spot off the Vegas strip is a great place for Korean BBQ.. The food is awesome because, you cook it yourself. If it's slow enough the staff stops by and cooks your meat for you while explaining what sauce to use for what meat. Their kim chee is very fresh and tasty. Becky was our waitress and she was very friendly and helpful whenever we had questions regarding the food. Being from Hawaii we have a lot of Korean BBQ but none with the type of pot stove that Honey Pig has. So instead of your regular yakuniku grill Honey Pig, has a oval shape stone type grill that resembles a top cover to a pot. Lol nothing was wrong from what I could see. This place has an all you can eat menu certain times through out the day and their regular menu is pretty affordable too. Another plus is that they're open 24 hours a day.. This place is a must whenever in Vegas..

photos.caption: Photo of Honey Pig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Vz-M5j0p4eE_GvnfGvFu_w.text: Order the sets! Includes a bottle of soju, and add a tall boy of Hite beer and the place becomes magical. KBBQ done right, but without a lot of side dishes, ban chan. The fried rice at the end is THE BEST, if you have room for it. We got the #2 set for 3 people and we were stuffed. I've been to the locations in LA and I will say the ones in LA are a little bit more well kept, but the food is still the same, good. Great for korean bbq beginners and great for groups. Who doesn't like grilling their food (or having the waitress doing it for you) right before your eyes?

vrUMFP4xfW-oidgmJTnv-g.text: One of the best things about this place is that it's open 24 hours. So if you don't feel like getting the obligatory steak & eggs after the club/drinking, then hit up this spot. It was very authentic, where I couldn't really read anything on the menu. My friend, a Vegas local, ordered for us. I know we got some type of brisket and veggies. The sides included your typical KBBQ sides and a bowl of salad. The meal came with rice, which was cooked at the end, but it didn't matter cause we tore that up, regardless. I enjoyed the tea that they served in the beginning, too. I thought it was dirty water, but it was tea, so don't be scared to drink it.  The thing that impressed me most was that our waitress actually cooked our meal for us. I haven't read any of the reviews for this place so I'm not sure if this was typical but maybe cause it was dead at like 3am? I don't know, either way it was good, drunk food. I'm sure it tastes even better when you're not intoxicated.

photos.caption: Photo of Honey Pig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So good

-lpB2Krw_BBBOcAXWn803w.text: Great taking pork slices and neck meat, as expected from honey pig.  Although their attention to service seems to be a bit slow compared the other store chains,  the quality of the meat makes up for it.  The GGot deung shim did not disappoint as well but I actually wished they added more rice for the fried rice mix at the end.

CPbSrlt4WWBMeIs3kZfhFA.text: Ok, first off, I heard of this place coz of my food buddy. He took one of his dates to this place and he said it was pretty good. So decided to check it out.   First impression, it's on the corner of the big lots shopping center. No biggie. Going in, I see that even though it's a respectable amount of diners esting, there's only 3 people working the floor. One if bussing the tables, 2 are actively serving the tables. Mind you, these 2 active servers have to help at least 7 tables each. 1 for each side of the restaurant. One server for potentially 10 tables each just means that their attention for each table is very minimal. At the time, there's only 7 tables active, but they would only be on the table for maximum of 1 minute each. There is also a language barrier with the servers, but it's ok. They made it up with friendliness. We waited to be seated for at least 10 minutes, that should not be a situation, but we walked in at the very same time as another couple and as soon as they walked in, they got seated...but not us even though they have open tables available. Also, when I ordered extra rice, I eat a lot of rice, I had to remind them about it. When it arrive, it wasn't warm but was still ok to eat.   Now onto the food itself. The meat was great especially the brisket and bulgogi. Everything else was a little too fatty, even for my taste. I've been known in my family and friends to be th e person to eat the fattiest steak. Some people would even call the steak that I like to be heart attack steak. But the meat that was serve was too fatty. I'm gonna need to workout a little extra coz of it. But, it was still good. I've been to another AYCE korean bbq, but in California,  and I'd do the one in California before I'd do this one again.   Overall, I'd give this place a 3 out of 5. Would I come back again? Maybe. Would I suggest this place to my friends? Yes, if they want to go to an AYCE. Would I suggest this place over the other places I've eaten in the area? I'd probably suggest other places in the area first before I would suggest honey pig. Only because it didn't give me the feeling of wanting to go back to this place. If I really want AYCE meat, I'd go to Swish over on Sahara. One other good thing about this place is that they are open 24 hours. Just thought I'd point that out, just in case anyone would be looking for a Korean bbq place at 4am.  This place can improve so much with just a few things. One of them would be hiring more people to accommodate the volume of clients. I get that budget might not be up to par, but in my experience, I've seen a whole different level of customer satisfaction just because the establishment hired more workers to make people happy. More workers would mean that orders wouldn't be forgotten, more time interacting with customers instead of rushing through customers, and increased volume of customers since they can accommodate them.

photos.caption: Photo of Honey Pig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cooked bulgogi...yum
Photo of Honey Pig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib...I still see it as the bacon from howls moving castle.
Photo of Honey Pig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgogi

Hjnf-d67GUWoO_3Dv1cZzA.text: We stopped for lunch - on a holiday weekend Sunday it was $26.95 dinner price. Server was welcoming, helpful and even after the place got busy she circled back regularly. That price gave us the upgrade to spicy shrimp and short rib which, in combination with the pork belly, veggies and sides, was more than enough food and delicious! They must have cleaned after the dirty dining episode as it was quite clean.  Delicious, fun experience and the macaron ice cream sandwich from Brick was the perfect finish!!

pP9t8xsHsrzhSaXXMleXDw.text: Nothing bad to say about this place.   Excellent food topped off by ending the meal with kimchi fried rice. The kimchi cooked while the meat cooked,  so the flavor of the fried rice was fantastic.

photos.caption: Photo of Honey Pig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Piggin&#39; out on the beef combo...

K-2S4xnVLRcfsDPZRwxhzw.text: Awesome food, spotty service. My family and I have been coming to Honey Pig for many years and they have always had very authentic, high quality food.   They get quite busy when there is a convention in town or on the weekends, and they don't offer AYCE during peak times (unless they just don't offer the menus to the guests...). I personally love their honeycomb pork belly, which is basically a THICK slab of bacon, and their beef brisket. Their kimchi and bean sprouts are bombbbb since they put it on the grill. Speaking of the grill, it's a giant round lid looking thing, so table space is a bit tight. It also tends to get extremely hot, but they have fans scattered around to try to relieve the guests, but just make sure you don't sit on the receiving end of all of the smoke that gets blown by the fans! Oh, and they should offer making fried rice out of the leftover meat and kimchi, but if they don't, definitely ask your server!   Service is inconsistent since there usually aren't enough employees for the amount of customers, but there is a service button on every table which you should definitely take advantage of because a server will be at your table almost instantly.   If you can overlook the spotty service and the slightly high prices, this is a fantastic, authentic Korean restaurant.

KXStH4q_J1lB928yRTlq-w.text: Poor lady, she was by herself on a busy afternoon. She was the host/server/cashier. Where did everybody go?  Anyway, the combo meals are on the high side but pretty generous for the amount of food you get. Basically, you cook your food on the grill on your table. The veggies, noodles, meat, etc. comes out one by one. One thing I did NOT like at all is that we had to eat our meals without rice because the server said we can only have rice at the end.  Excuse me, huh? What? I'm Asian. I need my rice with my meal. I don't eat rice after. I eat rice during. She was also in control of what gets cooked, how it's cooked, etc. We asked things multiple times because she kept forgetting or she was just by herself and didn't have time to everything at once. I understood and did not complain. Actually felt bad for her.   Ugh, I dont know if I'll ever be back. If I'm craving Korean BBQ, I'll just go to Sura. Or if someone suggests something better, message me! :)

jc5lFYKn-IaIUV7WhG2y-A.text: Service a little slow but food was great. I didn't like that I had to ask for the fried rice that was included in my meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Honey Pig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly meal is enough to feed 4.

-OtpDz0HW4GPCgbbNSV9Sw.text: May I just throw it out there.. NEVER COMING BACK TO THIS PLACE.  The service was super slow considering the amount of people that were in here when we went.   And although the price is average, the serving was rather on the small side.  There's so many Korean restaurants out there that will give you more food and better service. Even when you have to cook for your own food, I'd rather do that than sit down here and wait for 49 years to get served!

rcn3-yRt9yLHue0VDryu7g.text: Everything was amazing. I took my kids here for a early dinner. We ate so much because everything was so good. Our server was super sweet and nice and she cooked everything for us. We will definitely be back !!!!!

bDOfXuKczKKY4snp_FM3qQ.text: Honey Pig!  How I Love Thee! Let me count  the ways...  - Staff, EXTREMELY Friendly - BBQ Grills, soo cool! With it's china man hat shape. Awesome! - BBQ. AYCE. Pork, Seafood, Beef, Chicken... and all the awesome other "stuff" that may scare people hehe. It was beyond delicious! - TONS of BanChan (little complimentary side dishes) - Soju... soo good - Sake. Unfiltered Sake to be exact. I can drink this til I'm silly its THAT GOOD - Beer. OB, can't go wrong!  One word to leave this review with - AUTHENTIC! Honey Pig will now me a mandatory stop for mi drunken night, even beating out my old drunken favorite, Pho Kim Long.

photos.caption: Photo of Honey Pig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

j6k5L-H1KmWuqErsR3d2Eg.text: Husband & I dropped in here after deciding that we didn't want pho, lol. Bonus points: They are 24/7! It was 10 o'clock on a Saturday night & there were probably only about five other people in the restaurant. It's a cute little korean restaurant that reminded me a lot of the korean bbq restaurants I see on korean dramas. We decided to do all-you-can-eat KBBQ for $26.95 per person which we thought was a little pricey especially since there's not much on their AYCE menu.   Their service here is spectacular, but then again we came in when there were literally five other people in the restaurant. They help cook the food for you which my husband liked cos he was a bit buzzed and not wanting to do any of the grilling, lol.   However, I can't say the same for their meat. It wasn't tender as I'd like it to be. I've been to plenty of AYCE KBBQ places in Vegas & I've had better quality meat. Their kimchi was okay too. Again, I've had better. What I did like was their soybean paste soup! It wasn't too salty or too watery which is a common mistake that other KBBQ places make with their soup.   I can't say if I would come again here to dine because of the price, variety of meat selections on their menu, and the quality. It just wasn't worth it for us. Maybe we'll try their non-AYCE menu next time. Sadly, this is a miss for us.

Kex7iEUSTG0UMeh4crBVnQ.text: Randomly stumbled upon this place and what can I say! The staff were so friendly and nice to us while also preparing our delicious meal. Coming New York, this is one of the best kbbq places I've been to because of the welcoming and warm environment as well as the tasty meat. Next time I'm around, I'll definitely come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Honey Pig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Set A I believe

3efz0GDRKECrz5lyzDp6KQ.text: I will never go to this place again. After we sat down and ordered we were informed that because it was the weekend that we would be paying the "all day price" instead of the $17.95 price that was on the lunch menu so now lunch was going to cost $26.95 but it was 1:00 pm. After we were done eating the check came and we were charged $30.85 per adult, that price is no where on the menu. And it is hard to complain due to the language barrier.

Photo of Honey Pig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

p_4lQR5hS0wblkr2gGhCCw.text: Do  not eat here!!!! The worst place ever!!!  Food was disgusting and customer service was of course the rudest!!! Place looks dirty, old and ugly. All you can eat was $29 and desert YOU HAVE TO PAY!!!! Overall tell everyone not to come here. Go somewhere else!!!!

24rwiN3ZhdNrEJuOAzKzZw.text: Heard really good things about this place, so I figure I had to try it while in Vegas. The set up is really nice here. The grilling area is quite unique, and allows you to grill a ton of food at one time without having to change the grill!   We ordered a whole bunch of assorted meats, but my favorite had to be the brisket. Typically I like marinated meats, but I wasn't feeling it. The food is overall just average in my opinion. Might have been due to the hype that I was expecting something insanely good, but I wasn't blown away. Some of the meat tasted a little off such as the short ribs... a few of us felt a tad bit of food poisoning the next day as well. We definitely cooked the meat to completion before eating it too.   The place is def overpriced for what it is. The service is good though, and the place is clean, and has great AC. Probably wouldn't go again to be honest.

photos.caption: Photo of Honey Pig - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Honey Pig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

J39H_8nWR9FLOTlw1b41nQ.text: Such a poor service. I went there today and was going to have a dinner but all of a sudden, they gave me menu what they usually provide a menu for convention people. I've already announced them that we are local, but they told me they only have convention menu which is way mote expensive than before. So I decide not to go there during convention period.

xChyiOT_j1GjMBfQJ8imMw.text: Completely hated this place!!! This review was for a visit we had a year ago. We went in, a family of 3, two adults and one child, got charged gratuity!! How is that possible with a small group? I could understand 5 or more... so this was a bit ridiculous.

Ay4SYf9HvQWPXXEukAPU9A.text: The service has definitely improved since my last visit.  Service buzzers are now at the table which makes it easier to get assistance.  If they were there before, I don't recall seeing them but our server definitely pointed it out this time.  Additionally, the staff was also pro-active with cooking the meat and checking on the table.  Great work. =)

rVIXJxuhtaLGwud0yYoP6Q.text: I love korean food. At all korean places I like try the soon tofu (soft tofu soup). I usually get the sofu soup with tofu. This place definitely had some good soup! I even ate it two days in a row. The reason I didn't give it five stars is the shrimp in the soup were ridiculously small... I didn't even know that shrimp could be that small. Other then that I was completely satisfied with my food and would definitely order from there again!

pakpaZxcDPFVAUp-oPABWQ.text: My husband and I were regulars until last time we visited.   We went on New year's eve @ 1am and it was packed with plenty of people. Probably 2/3 of the area was full. We got the pork combo A, which comes with beef brisket, pork belly, soup and fried rice at the end. By the time when we were finished with the meat part, we were waiting for the server to make the fried rice for us. But- no. I noticed other tables who were before us also had finished their meat, but I did not see any fried rice made for them.   The server seemed very overwhelming, I mean, I understand you being busy but he kept ignoring us. He did not even bring us the soup. So we gave up on it because other people did not get theirs either. Yes, we gave up. So basically, we paid 55 dollars for very little portion of the beef brisket, pork belly, and some side dishes. HOW RIDICULOUS!!!!!!!! I think our server purposely ignored to serve us the soup and make the fried rice for us. I felt so sorry for all the people who were there. This is my last straw and I'm not going back!!!

Rl_2npzv33rXnPVyumpIDQ.text: First, I thought the lunch Ayce was good on the weekends too but I found out that it was not.  That's okay, though, not too bummed about that since there are things you can order that isn't on the lunch menu.    Next came the ordering.  We sampled everything on the menu.  Overall I think the meats are less marinated.  I like heavily marinated flavors in meats.  On a scale rating for tasty meats, If hobak is a 9, then tofu hut a 6, then this place is a 5.  Cleanliness this place is better than tofu hut on par with hobak, but I'm here for the taste.    The complimentary kimchi was marginal at best.  Only unique one was the seaweed.  The salad dressing was nice and sweet.  The rest is just common.    Final bill came to be 60 ish which is average for Korean bbq.    If I'm craving for good kbque, I would go to hobak.  If I'm craving for value, tofu hut.  Not sure if I would come back here.

48soK7BNDHh4ARZDDk63ag.text: Get the A.Y.C.E. it is some of the better A.Y.C.E. in the city. The brisket is tender not hard and they have more side options than a lot of places. Good price especially at lunchtime.   Just make sure you get your change.   The last time we were there the waitress took our money and came back to say goodbye without the change. This is the only time it has happened but still we won't be back. I usually forgive mistakes but that was a big one.

WMmOGiyNyY7GYX4olXmjFw.text: I had a great experience!  We found this place while driving around in Las Vegas and chose to eat here because the name sounded enticing. I'm glad we picked this place because the food and service was pretty nice. The portions are hefty and everything is well seasoned. The staff will assist in preparing your food if you are not familiar with the process (this was my first time eating K BBQ). The staff are friendly and attentive. The atmosphere is good too, everyone here seemed to enjoy the food very much.  I will definitely be coming back next time I'm in Las Vegas.

ApIjp5kFnrv0GQKEMlvtmg.text: Good food but not worth it compared to other eat all you can eat kbbq. I strongly not recommend this place. BTW check your recipt, they overcharged sometimes.

OKr3bsXPXOIXy5qRZAnKVQ.text: Service terrible very very slow and not much selection for all you can eat . Not value money at all !!!! Never go back again !!!!

QAcIKbU0ZQYxg91SHcq_-Q.text: Ate yesterday after a long trip to Vegas from CA. AfTer many years of fine dinning including Korean BBQ, this place is by far the WORSE place I have ever eaten. Service was not existent. The food had barely enough meat to feed 3 people and lacked seasoning/flavor. If you are used to eating quality Korean BBQ, this is then NOT the restaurant for you. :/

RUSLzs9wZDrXQttfqpXB-w.text: Went to Honey Pig with son and husband for the first time. We loved it !!! Becky explained the whole process perfectly and cooked us the ears to our likings. We will back soon!

Al2mq3_t_9A2gkk5F804jg.text: The worst WORST Korean BBQ restaurant in Vegas!   The service getting worse and worse every time!  4 services talking and watching TV during their work time.They didn't do their job at all.   They gave extra briskets instead of beef tongues then charged us $29.99 !!!  Don't waste your money at such bad restaurant!
